titleStmt.title: Thomas H. Corbett et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4262

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Blandville Ky Octr 6" 1863
To his Excellency
Thomas E Bramlett
Govenor of Kentucky
Respected sir --

The undersigned citizens of Ballard County will respectfully state to your Excellency, that at the present Term of the Ballard Circuit Court Joseph Mansfield was tried on two Indictments one for Keeping a gaming house and the other for keeping a tippling house for three months at one time, and was fined two hundred Dollars in each case the lowest finds amount that the law would authorize the Jury in finding -- Your petitioners will Respectfully State that said Mansfield is an illiterate man and did ^not^ know at the time, that he was violating the law, so soon as he found out that it was against the law he quit suffering persons to play in his house for the Drinks or any thing else, and quit selling Whiskey -- He is a very poor man and has a large and almost a helpless family to support. In fact he cant pay the fines in No way but by lying in Jail We therefore pray your Excellency to remit the aforesaid fines as We are confident that the said Mansfield will not be guilty of the but like again
and will ever pray &c

Thos. H. Corbett
J. Edwards
C L Hickman
James Armstrong
T. P. Young
S. S. Stall
G M L Jones
John Burrow

Milburn Ballard County oct 12
Gov Bramlette
Dear Sir
at the request of Mr Mansfield I cordially represent that what the within petition represents is strictly true and as far as my Knowledge Extends the names appended are genuine

Respectfully Submited
Thos P Hays
Representative Elect from Ballard County

Respite one of the Judgts 6 months & the other 12 months
Oct 24th 1863
Tho E Bramlette
Govr

John S. Sedy
